body_html:
@Androbin it's not shipped with CUDA indeed, but you can install cuDNN in two ways on Ubuntu:

  1. Extract an archive anywhere on your filesystem.
  2. Use our machine learning deb package repository and apt-get install -y libcudnn6

On CentOS, you only have option 1.
body_text:
@Androbin it's not shipped with CUDA indeed, but you can install cuDNN in two ways on Ubuntu:

Extract an archive anywhere on your filesystem.
Use our machine learning deb package repository and apt-get install -y libcudnn6

On CentOS, you only have option 1.
body:
@Androbin it's not shipped with CUDA indeed, but you can install cuDNN in two ways on Ubuntu:
1. Extract an archive anywhere on your filesystem.
2. Use our machine learning deb package repository and `apt-get install -y libcudnn6`

On CentOS, you only have option 1.
